channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped bags of rubbish ripped open by foxes, 12th July
item.description:
Bags of rubbish dumped on either side of Jenkins Road leading to Ealdham Primary school - again. The bags have been ripped open by foxes and the rubbish is all over the road. This is happening once a month!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jeken Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: '20' zone street sign damaged and leaning dangerously, 12th July
item.description:
'20' zone street sign on Grove End Road about 75m from the junction with Wellington Road is damaged; the fixing in the ground is disturbed and loose, and the sign is leaning dangerously

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72-76, Grove End Road, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: U Entrance to Westminster college, 12th July
item.description:
Sorry there is was very bad smell today in morning around 10.00am I turn right i am going to tower hall the building and go Westminster college and it was very bad smell it was on the floor very dirty smell is killing everyone and me this smell is still in my head
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 349, Edgware Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflow bins and waste, 12th July
item.description:
This is the second time reporting this even though the website says ‘fixed.’ Please can you assist to take this fly tipped bin and furniture away from the street? It’s blocking the sidewalk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brayards Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead pigeon, 12th July
item.description:
I found a dead pigeon right at the edge of our path where it meets the pavement. I have bagged it up and put the bag behind the bin, between the bin and the hedge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Anerley, London

item.description:

item.title: Tree branche has fallen off, 12th July
item.description:
Please removed the fallen tree brach. I was walking past the tree and all of a sudden behind me heard a loud noise and when I tuned around a huge trr brahe. Has fallen behind. Please can this be removed. The other trees needs to be checked too I noticed a few other breaches that could potentially fall with the wind.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowper Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen / Broken branch from tree overhanging path, 12th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Bickley, London

item.title: New lamp post not secure., 12th July
item.description:
The new lampost outside my house is not fixed in the ground very well. It sways in the wind quite significantly and now the pavement around it has started to crack and pull up. (See image) This seems worse every day. As i dont know how much of it is buried underground i dont know how likely it is to fall over but if it does it could hit houses, phone lines and cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why is this still here, 12th July
item.description:
Hackney, take care of this! This is a health concern! Bugs and rodents and rubbish allowed to accumulate! It is rubbish - dump it! I will be reporting this to London City as I see many people have responded to this issue and it is still there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Coffee table, 12th July
item.description:
Dumped on the bee flower garden. Who does that? Absolute twats, that’s who. Please remove and fine those responsible. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Durning Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A lovely family, 12th July
item.description:
Black Nissan Qashqai. They opened their car doors and then emptied all the rubbish from their car on to the road. Simply rude. Cat was with them, white, grey and ginger. Unable to reply in English when spoken to. Man and women. Women was about 45 years old and man about 18. Lovely bottles and tissues left everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendale Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crayford, 12th July
item.description:
The wall is full broken and fall down in my property . It’s my second time complaint to you because it’s dangerous for my kids and school kids also use this way to going school. Please solve this problem as soon as possible thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iron Mill Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
